description.title: Advice to be followed before any operation

descbody.para: For an operation requiring the use of a lift, follow the safety instructions vehicle : towing and liftingGIEMR-002447.

description.title: Instructions to be followed during the operation

descbody.para: Using a mixture of two incompatible brake fluids in the brake circuit may give rise to:

ul.li: serious risk of leakage due mainly to deterioration of the cups,

descbody.para: To avoid such risks, it is essential to only use RENAULT standard approved brake fluidsvehicle: parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445.

noteR.para: Switch off the vehicle ignition so as not to activate the hydraulic unit solenoid valves when bleeding the brake circuit.

ul.li: The pipes between the master cylinder, the callipers, and the hydraulic unit are connected using threaded unions with a metric thread.
Therefore, only parts specified in the Parts Catalogue for this vehicle should be used.

noteR.para: To ensure that the ABS and ESP systems operate correctly, check that the underbody brake pipes are clipped in place and are not crossed.
To avoid any accident, bring the pistons, brake pads and brake discs into contact by depressing the brake pad several times.

descbody.para: If, during work on the brake system, any damage on any part is observed, it must be repaired before driving the vehicle again.

description.title: Advice to be followed before any operation

descbody.para: Protect any bodywork components that risk being damaged by brake fluid with a cover.

description.title: Instructions to be followed during the operation

descbody.para: To avoid contaminating the brake circuit, do not allow the brake circuit components to drop on the ground.
Clean around the braking system using brake cleaner vehicle: parts and consumables for the repairGIEMR-002445.

noteR.para: Prepare for the flow of fluid, and protect the surrounding components.

descbody.para: Always replace the master cylinder seals.
Check that the brake servo seal is in place. Replace the seal if it is damaged.

It is essential to replace the master cylinder/brake servo assembly when the master cylinder leaks into the brake servo. The brake servo becomes unusable when the rubber diaphragm is contaminated with brake fluid.

noteR.para: To avoid breaking the connection between the brake servo pushrod and the brake pedal, check that the safety clevis pin is locked onto the brake servo pushrod by tilting it from the top downwards.
In order not to damage the brake hose:

ul.li: check that there is no contact with the surrounding components.
